member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation.
member.param: The buffer to read the data into.
The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data read from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
An optional asynchronous callback, to be called when the read is complete.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.

member.exception: One or more of the arguments is invalid.
buffer is null.
The current Stream implementation does not support the read operation.
Disconnect occurred on the stream's connection
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request to finish.
member.returns: The number of bytes read from the stream, between zero (0) and the number of bytes you requested. Streams return zero (0) only at the end of the stream, otherwise, they should block until at least one byte is available.
member.exception: asyncResult is null.
asyncResult did not originate from a CrestronIO.Stream.BeginRead(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object) method on the current stream.

member.summary: Gets the Timeout Status of this connection.

member.summary: Determines if BufferedAsync is available or not. When set to true, data will not be returned until the specified maximum buffer size is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.AsyncCallbackAvailable
member.summary: Determines if We are going to invoke an AsyncCallback on this IAsyncResult.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.Timeout
member.summary: The Timeout property specifies the maximum amount of time (in seconds) that a Connection will wait for incoming data within a single Receive operation. The timeout handling can be activated by the TimeoutEnabled property, the default value is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.TimeoutEnabled
member.summary: The TimeoutEnabled property toggles whether the Connection will do automatic timeout checking. When turned on (true), the Connection will keep track of the time that passes during any single Receive operation - if a receive operation takes longer than the given timeout, the connection will be terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.MaxLineLength
member.summary: The MaxLineLength property specifies the maximum number of bytes that a ReadLine operation will receive. The maximum line checking can be activated by the MaxLineLengthEnabled property, the default value is 1024 bytes (1kB).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.MaxLineLengthEnabled
member.summary: The MaxLineLengthEnabled property toggles whether the ReadLine function will enforce a maximum line length. When turned on (true), ReadLine will fail and the connection will be terminated if the remote side sends a line longer than the defined MaxLineLength bytes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Connection.Connected
member.summary: The boolean Connected property can be evaluated at any given time to find out if the Connection object is referring to an open Connection. When a connection is first obtained, it will be open and the property will be true. Once the connection has been closed, whether purposely or by remote, the property will turn to false.

member.summary: HTTP v1.0

member.summary: SOCKS 4

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxyType.SOCKS4A
member.summary: SOCKS 4A

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod
member.summary: The method of authentication to an HTTPS server

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.NONE
member.summary: No authentication method defined = default (BASIC)

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.BASIC
member.summary: HTTP Basic authentication. This is the default choice, and the only method that is in wide-spread use and supported virtually everywhere. This sends the user name and password over the network in plain text, easily captured by others.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.DIGEST
member.summary: HTTP Digest authentication. Digest authentication is defined in RFC 2617 and is a more secure way to do authentication over public networks than the regular old-fashioned Basic method.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.DIGEST_IE
member.summary: HTTP Digest authentication with an IE flavor. Digest authentication is defined in RFC 2617 and is a more secure way to do authentication over public networks than the regular old-fashioned Basic method.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.NEGOTIATE
member.summary: HTTP Negotiate (SPNEGO) authentication. Negotiate authentication is defined in RFC 4559 and is the most secure way to perform authentication over HTTP.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.NTLM
member.summary: HTTP NTLM authentication. A proprietary protocol invented and used by Microsoft. It uses a challenge-response and hash concept similar to Digest, to prevent the password from being eavesdropped.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.NTLM_WB
member.summary: NTLM delegating to winbind helper. Authentication is performed by a separate binary application that is executed when needed. The name of the application is specified at compile time but is typically /usr/bin/ntlm_auth

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.ANY
member.summary: This is a convenience macro that sets all bits and thus makes the client pick any it finds suitable. The client will automatically select the one it finds most secure.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.ANYSAFE
member.summary: This is a convenience macro that sets all bits except Basic and thus makes the client pick any it finds suitable. The client will automatically select the one it finds most secure.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.AuthMethod.ONLY
member.summary: This is a meta symbol. OR this value together with a single specific auth value to force the client to probe for un-restricted auth and if not, only that single auth algorithm is acceptable.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings
member.summary: The class representing proxy settings

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Proxy Settings class
member.param: The proxy's Host Name/IP address or fully qualified URL which will be used as the proxy regardless of the rest of the settings
member.remarks: If just a Host Name or IP address is provided, the rest of non-default proxy attributes must be also provided. The defaults are: - 'HTTP' for Proxy type - 1080 for Proxy Port number - Empty Proxy User Name and Password for authentication A fully qualified URL in the form of [proxy_type://][user_name:password@]my_proxy_host_name_or_ip_address[:port_number] would define everything. Empty string provided explicitly disables any use of proxy with a request.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.Port
member.summary: Sets or gets the proxy server's port number to be used instead of the default one.
member.remarks: Setting a value explicitly defines the port number if not provided by proxy URL. Setting to 0 clears the overriding value which means default proxy port (1080) or the one from URL will be used. Note that the getter does not return the port from the URL but the one set to override the default value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.Type
member.summary: Sets or gets the proxy server's type to be used instead of the default one.
member.remarks: Setting a value explicitly defines the proxy type if not provided by proxy URL. Setting to 'NONE' clears the overriding value which means default type (HTTP) or the one from URL will be used. Note that the getter does not return the proxy type from the URL but the one set to override the default value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Sets or gets the proxy server's authentication method to be used instead of the default one.
member.remarks: This is a bitmask, to tell the client which HTTP authentication method(s) you want it to use for your proxy authentication. If more than one bit is set, the client will first query the site to see what authentication methods it supports and then pick the best one you allow it to use.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.UserName
member.summary: Sets or gets the User Name that will be used to authenticate to the proxy.
member.remarks: Setting a value explicitly defines the proxy user name if not provided by proxy URL. Setting to null clears the overriding value which means no user name or the one from URL will be used. Note that the getter does not return the proxy user name from the URL but the one set to override the default value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.UserPassword
member.summary: Sets or gets the Password that will be used to authenticate to the proxy.
member.remarks: Setting a value explicitly defines the proxy user password if not provided by proxy URL. Setting to null clears the overriding value which means no user password or the one from URL will be used. Note that the getter does not return the proxy user password from the URL but the one set to override the default value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.ProxySettings.HostOrUrl
member.summary: Sets or gets the proxy's Host Name/IP address or fully qualified URL which will be used as the proxy regardless of the rest of the settings.
member.remarks: If just a Host Name or IP address is provided, the rest of non-default proxy attributes must be also provided. The defaults are: - 'HTTP' for Proxy type - 1080 for Proxy Port number - Empty Proxy User Name and Password for authentication A fully qualified URL in the form of [proxy_type://][user_name:password@]my_proxy_host_name_or_ip_address[:port_number] would define everything. Empty string provided explicitly disables any use of proxy with a request. This property represents the string provided in the constructor.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType
member.summary: Specifies the type of value searched for by the X509Certificate2Collection.Find(X509FindType,System.Object,System.Boolean) method.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType.FindByThumbprint
member.summary: The findValue parameter for the X509Certificate2Collection.Find(X509FindType,System.Object,System.Boolean) method must be a string representing the thumbprint of the certificate.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType.FindBySubjectName
member.summary: The findValue parameter for the X509Certificate2Collection.Find(X509FindType,System.Object,System.Boolean) method must be a string representing the subject name of the certificate. This is a less specific search than if you use the X509FindType.FindBySubjectDistinguishedName enumeration value. Using the X509FindType.FindBySubjectName value, the X509Certificate2Collection.Find(X509FindType,System.Object,System.Boolean) method performs a case-insensitive string compare using the supplied value. For example, if you pass "MyCert" to the X509Certificate2Collection.Find(X509FindType,System.Object,System.Boolean) method, it will find all certificates with the subject name containing that string, regardless of other subject values. Searching by distinguished name is a more precise search.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileStream
member.summary: SimplSharp.CrestronIO FileStream Instance of a file supporting synchronous read and write operations.

members.member:
INTERNAL: Initialize the FileStream with the specified path and access. FileMode is set to OpenOrCreate.
Full path of the file the stream will encapsulate. Constant that specifies the file access allowed by the stream. (Read, Write, etc.) Invalid directory location passed. File System error while attempting to open the stream. Invalid directory location. The file passed does not exist. Path is great than 248 characters. Invalid argument passed. One of the arguments is null. The user does not have the required permissions. Mode or FileAccess are invalid. The file is of a non-file system type. The access requested is not permitted for the specified file.:

Initializes a new instance of the CrestronIO.FileStream class with the specified path and creation mode.
A relative or absolute path for the file that the current FileStream object will encapsulate.
A CrestronIO.FileMode constant that determines how to open or create the file.
path is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters. -or-path refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment. exception>
path refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in a non-NTFS environment.
path is null.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The file cannot be found, such as when mode is FileMode.Truncate or FileMode.Open, and the file specified by path does not exist. The file must already exist in these modes.
An I/O error occurs, such as specifying FileMode.CreateNew and the file specified by path already exists.-or-The stream has been closed.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
mode contains an invalid value.
The access requested is not permitted for the specified file.:

Initialize the FileStream with the specified path, mode, and access.
Full path of the file the stream will encapsulate. Specified mode to open the file. (Open, Append, etc.) Constant that specifies the file access allowed by the stream. (Read, Write, etc.) Invalid directory location passed. File System error while attempting to open the stream. Invalid directory location. The file passed does not exist. Path is great than 248 characters. Invalid argument passed. One of the arguments is null. The user does not have the required permissions. Mode or FileAccess are invalid. The file is of a non-file system type. The access requested is not permitted for the specified file.:

Initializes a new instance of the CrestronIO.FileStream class with the specified path, creation mode, read/write permission, and sharing permission.
A relative or absolute path for the file that the current FileStream object will encapsulate.
A CrestronIO.FileMode constant that determines how to open or create the file.
A CrestronIO.FileAccess constant that determines how the file can be accessed by the FileStream object. This gets the CrestronIO.FileStream.CanRead and CrestronIO.FileStream.CanWrite properties of the FileStream object. CrestronIO.FileStream.CanSeek is true if path specifies a disk file.
A CrestronIO.FileShare constant that determines how the file will be shared by processes.
path is null.
path is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters. -or-path refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment.
path refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in a non-NTFS environment.
path is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
The file cannot be found, such as when mode is FileMode.Truncate or FileMode.Open, and the file specified by path does not exist. The file must already exist in these modes.
An I/O error occurs, such as specifying FileMode.CreateNew and the file specified by path already exists. -or-The system is running Windows 98 or Windows 98 Second Edition and share is set to FileShare.Delete.-or-The stream has been closed.
The caller does not have the required permission.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
The access requested is not permitted by the operating system for the specified path, such as when access is Write or ReadWrite and the file or directory is set for read-only access.
The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
mode contains an invalid value.
The access requested is not permitted for the specified file.:

Initializes a new instance of the CrestronIO.FileStream class with the specified path, creation mode, read/write and sharing permission, and buffer size.
A relative or absolute path for the file that the current FileStream object will encapsulate.
A CrestronIO.FileMode constant that determines how to open or create the file.
A CrestronIO.FileAccess constant that determines how the file can be accessed by the FileStream object. This gets the CrestronIO.FileStream.CanRead and CrestronIO.FileStream.CanWrite properties of the FileStream object. CrestronIO.FileStream.CanSeek is true if path specifies a disk file.
A CrestronIO.FileShare constant that determines how the file will be shared by processes.
A positive System.Int32 value greater than 0 indicating the buffer size. For bufferSize values between one and eight, the actual buffer size is set to eight bytes.
path is null.
path is an empty string (""), contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters. -or-path refers to a non-file device, such as "con:", "com1:", "lpt1:", etc. in an NTFS environment.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAccess
member.summary: Defines constants for read, write, or read/write access to a file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAccess.Read
member.summary: Read access to the file. Data can be read from the file. Combine with Write for read/write access.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAccess.Write
member.summary: Write access to the file. Data can be written to the file. Combine with Read for read/write access.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAccess.ReadWrite
member.summary: Read and write access to the file. Data can be written to and read from the file.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system should open a file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.CreateNew
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new file. If the file already exists, an IOException is thrown.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.Create
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new file. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.Open
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open an existing file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.OpenOrCreate
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open a file if it exists; otherwise, a new file should be created.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.Truncate
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open an existing file. Once opened, the file should be truncated so that its size is zero bytes.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileMode.Append
member.summary: Opens the file if it exists and seeks to the end of the file, or creates a new file. FileMode.Append can only be used in conjunction with FileAccess.Write.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileShare
member.summary: Defines constants for controlling the kind of access other CrestronIO.FileStream objects can have to the same file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileShare.None
member.summary: Declines sharing of the current file. Any request to open the file (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileShare.Read
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileShare.Write
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileShare.ReadWrite
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading or writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading or writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read-only.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.System
member.summary: The file is a system file. The file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The file is a directory.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Archive
member.summary: The file's archive status. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Device
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The file is normal and has no other attributes set. This attribute is valid only if used alone.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Temporary
member.summary: The file is temporary. File systems attempt to keep all of the data in memory for quicker access rather than flushing the data back to mass storage. A temporary file should be deleted by the application as soon as it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.SparseFile
member.summary: The file is a sparse file. Sparse files are typically large files whose data are mostly zeros.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.ReparsePoint
member.summary: The file contains a reparse point, which is a block of user-defined data associated with a file or a directory.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Compressed
member.summary: The file is compressed.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.FileAttributes.Offline

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextReader.Peek
member.summary: Reads the next character without changing the state of the reader or the character source. Returns the next available character without actually reading it from the input stream.
member.returns: An integer representing the next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the stream does not support seeking.
member.exception: The CrestronIO.TextReader is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next character from the input stream and advances the character position by one character.
member.returns: The next character from the input stream, or -1 if no more characters are available. The default implementation returns -1.
member.exception: The CrestronIO.TextReader is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of characters to read. If the end of the stream is reached before count of characters is read into buffer, the current method returns.
member.returns: The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether the data is available within the stream. This method returns zero if called when no more characters are left to read.
member.exception: buffer is null.
The buffer length minus index is less than count.
index or count is negative.
The CrestronIO.TextReader is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextReader.ReadBlock(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream, and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.param: When this method returns, this parameter contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count -1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of characters to read.
member.returns: The position of the underlying stream is advanced by the number of characters that were read into buffer.The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether all input characters have been read.
member.exception: buffer is null.
The buffer length minus index is less than count.
index or count is negative.
The CrestronIO.TextReader is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextReader.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line of characters from the current stream and returns the data as a string.
member.returns: The next line from the input stream, or null if all characters have been read.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
There is insufficient memory to allocate a buffer for the returned string.
The CrestronIO.TextReader is closed.

Determines whether data is to be appended to the file. If the file exists and append is false, the file is overwritten. If the file exists and append is true, the data is appended to the file. Otherwise, a new file is created.
member.exception: Access is denied.
path is empty. -or-path contains the name of a system device (com1, com2, and so on).
path is null.
The specified path is invalid, such as being on an unmapped drive.
path includes an incorrect or invalid syntax for file name, directory name, or volume label syntax.

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The caller does not have the required permission.

The index of buffer at which to begin writing.
The maximum number of characters to read.

buffer is null.
index or count is negative.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice
member.summary:
Extended Service Device class is used to send and receive out-of-band information such as extended data service from Crestron Ethernet devices.
If the device or the control system does not support this form of communication, it will never come online.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.Connect(Crestron.SimplSharp.eCrestronExtendedService)
member.summary:
Method to connect to the application's framework service channel for this device.
The device needs to be registered with the control system and to support the Extended Service information protocol. If the protocol is not supported by the device the member will remain false and the service asked for is unavailable.
member.param: The service asked for which is represented as enumeration .
member.exception: If the serviceAsked is invalid.
If the service is already registered or connected, or the device is disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.UserNotify(Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceEventArgs)
member.summary: Notify the end user of incoming service data or status.

member.summary: Convert the string to byte array.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.SendString(System.UInt32,System.String,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronStringEncoding)
member.summary: Method to send a string value to the device.
member.param: The channel (join) number to set this value to. This is a zero based number from 0 to 65535.
New string value to send to the device. This string can only be a maximum length of 65535 bytes.
member.exception: If channel number, value length or encoding type is invalid.
If the device is disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.SendBool(System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to send a bool value to the device and this is not supported for now.
member.param: The channel (join) number to set this value to. This is a zero based number from 0 to 65535.
New bool value to send to the device.
member.exception: The method is not supported.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.SendUShort(System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Method to send a ushort value to the device and this is not supported for now.
member.param: The channel (join) number to set this value to. This is a zero based number from 0 to 65535.
New ushort (analog) value to send to the device.
member.exception: The method is not supported.

member.summary: IP ID of the device. This ID is an 8-bit value representation of the device symbol in the SIMPL Windows/SIMPL# Pro application.

member.summary: Service ID that associates with the extended service which is requested for. This ID is represented with the enumeration .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.IsOnline
member.summary:
Get the current online state for the device.
When the property is true, the service requested is connected and the extended service device is ready for the next phase operation.
When the property is false, the service requested is not available.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.ExtendedServiceDevice.ReceiveEvent
member.summary:
Information received from the Service Device will trigger this event.
This includes changes to the property and when a string, bool, or ushort value are received.
Currently only string value is supported.

Reed-Solomon code parameters: (12,8) reversible code:
G(x) = x^4 + (a+1/a)x^3 + ax^2 + (a+1/a)x + 1
where a = primitive root of field generator 0x14D

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Client.DnsResolveType
member.summary: Determines if the specified HostName should be looked up only: Once per application run (if you establish multiple connections to the server, the subsequent connections will use the cached IPAddress) or Always, for each connect (the Hostname will be resolved again for each subsequent connect). You'll usually only change this setting off the default (Once) if you anticipate the IPAddress of the target host to change frequently.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Client.Binding
member.summary: Obsolete - Please use BindingV4 and BindingV6 instead.

member.summary: Gets the binding which provides properties and methods such as address family, IPv6 address, port number etc for client to connect to the host network.

member.summary: The server Port that you intend the client to connect to. If you do not assign a port number on this property, the port number in the parsed URL will be used. If a port number is assigned in the parsed URL, it will take precedence over this property.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Client.OnResolveHostName
member.summary: This event is fired before the Client attempts to resolve the specified HostName to an IP address. It provides you with an option to perform the resolution yourself, obtain the IP address from an internal cache you're maintaining, or do some other processing (such as for example changing the hostname to look up).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP
member.summary: Class-wrapper for zip functionality from Utilities DLL

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.UnZipHere(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to unzip an archive to a specified (optional) destination folder with password (optional)
member.param: The path to the zip file to unzip
The path to the destination folder to unzip to (optional). If NULL or empty, the folder with the name of the zip file w/o extension is created beside the zip file.
The password to the zip file if encrypted

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ZipTo(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to zip a file or a folder (recursive) to an archive with password (optional)
member.param: The path to the zip file to zip to. If NULL or empty, the path is built from the name of the source file or folder with .zip extension appended.
The path to the source file or folder (recursive) to zip.
The password to the zip file if encrypted

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.Unzip(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to unzip an archive to a specified (optional) destination folder
member.param: The path to the zip file to unzip
The path to the destination folder to unzip to (optional). If NULL or empty, the files are unzipped to the folder where the zip file resides.
member.returns: Result code indicating success or failure
member.remarks: The zip file is not deleted after unzipping. This operation overwrites any existing file in the destination folder with the same name. However, if the destination folder has an existing folder with the same name as one of the file(s) being unzipped then the file will not be unzipped and ZR_NOFILE error will be returned. Conversely, if we have a folder in the file being unzipped and the destination folder contains a file with the same name then the folder will not be unzipped with ZR_NOFILE error returned.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.Zip(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to zip a file or a folder (including subfolders) to an zip file.
member.param: The path to the zip file to zip to. If NULL or empty, the path is built from the name of the source file or folder with .zip extension appended.
The path to the source file or folder to zip.
member.returns: Result code indicating error or success

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode
member.summary: These are the result codes of a zip/unzip operation.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_OK
member.summary: Everything went OK.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_RECENT
member.summary: nb. the pseudo-code zr-recent is never returned, but can be passed to FormatZipMessage.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_GENMASK
member.summary: The following come from general system stuff (e.g. files not openable)

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NODUPH
member.summary: couldn't duplicate the handle

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOFILE
member.summary: couldn't create/open the file or folder

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOALLOC
member.summary: failed to allocate some resource

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_WRITE
member.summary: a general error writing to the file

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOTFOUND
member.summary: couldn't find that file in the zip

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_MORE
member.summary: there's still more data to be unzipped

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_CORRUPT
member.summary: the zipfile is corrupt or not a zipfile

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_READ
member.summary: a general error reading the file

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_PASSWORD
member.summary: we didn't get the right password to unzip the file

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_CALLERMASK
member.summary: The following come from mistakes on the part of the caller

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_ARGS
member.summary: general mistake with the arguments

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOTMMAP
member.summary: tried to ZipGetMemory, but that only works on mmap zipfiles, which yours wasn't

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_MEMSIZE
member.summary: the memory size is too small

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_FAILED
member.summary: the thing was already failed when you called this function

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_ENDED
member.summary: the zip creation has already been closed

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_MISSIZE
member.summary: the indicated input file size turned out mistaken

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_PARTIALUNZ
member.summary: the file had already been partially unzipped

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_ZMODE
member.summary: tried to mix creating/opening a zip

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_BUGMASK
member.summary: The following come from bugs within the zip library itself

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOTINITED
member.summary: initialization didn't work

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_SEEK
member.summary: trying to seek in an unseekable file

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_NOCHANGE
member.summary: changed its mind on storage, but not allowed

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronZIP.ResultCode.ZR_FLATE
member.summary: an internal error in the de/inflation code

member.summary: Returns the HTTP body in the form of a byte array. Unexpected end of response - Content Length does not match length read.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpIncomingRequestResponse.ContentStream
member.summary: Returns a Stream object with the HTTP body of the received request (server) or response (client). Because ContentStream provides you with direct access to the underlying Connection Stream, it is the fastest and most efficient way to access the response (as opposed to ContentString and ContentBytes, both of which involve copying the entire data from the stream into a memory buffer).

member.summary: Returns the HTTP body in form of a String object.

member.summary: Specifies whether the HTTP header provides a ContentLength field.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpIncomingRequestResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: Contains the ContentLength header value received from the remote side. If the remote did not provide a length (for example in HTTP 1.0 scenarios, or if Keep-Alive is not supported), accessing the property will raise an exception. Use the HasContentLength property to determine if a valid ContentLength has been received.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpIncomingRequestResponse.KeepAlive
member.summary: Keeps the HTTP Request Response connection alive. If enabled (true), once a request is made and a connection is established, this connection is kept open and used for future requests. If disabled, the connection is closed, and a new connection is created for future requests.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronMailFunctions
member.summary: Sending Email through devices.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronMailFunctions.SmtpPort
member.summary: Port number for the system

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronMailFunctions.SendMail(System.String,System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Programmatically sends an email message to the specified IP address on the specified port using the SMTP protocol.
member.param: Required. Specifies address of the mail server. It can either be an IP address in dot-decimal notation (ex: 192.168.16.3) or a name to be resolved with a DNS server (ex: mail.myisp.com). If a name is given, the control system must be configured with a DNS server (ADDDNS console command). Maximum field length: 40.
Required. Specifies the port number used to send the email.

Optional. If the mail server requires authentication, UserLogonName indicates the user name of the sender for the mail server. An empty string indicates that authentication is not required. Only "clear text" authentication is implemented. "Clear text" refers to the authentication method used by the mail server. If the mail server requires a higher level authentication, mail can not be sent to the mail server. Maximum field length: 254.

Optional. If the mail server requires authentication, UserLogonPassword indicates the password of the sender for the mail server. An empty string indicates that authentication is not required. Only "clear text" authentication is implemented, used by the server. If the mail server requires a higher level authentication, mail can not be sent to the mail server. Maximum field length: 254.

Required. Specifies the e-mail address of the sender in the a@b.com format. Only one email address is allowed. Aliases or nicknames are not supported. This argument is mandatory. Maximum field length: 242.
Required. Specifies the e-mail address of the recipient(s) in the a@b.com format. Multiple recipients may be specified delimited with a ";". Maximum field length: 65535.

Optional. An empty string indicates that there are no recipients. Specifies the e-mail address of the carbon copy recipient(s) in the a@b.com format. Multiple recipients may be specified delimited with a ";". Maximum field length: 65535.
Optional. Specifies the subject of the email message. An empty string indicates that there is no subject. Maximum field length: 989.
Optional. Specifies the body of the email message. An empty string indicates an empty message. Maximum field length: 65535.
Optional. Specifies the number of attachments to be sent. Zero (0) specifies that there are no attachments.
Optional. An empty string indicates that no attachments are to be sent. Specifies the files to be attached. Multiple filenames may be specified, delimited by ';'. Max field length is 65534.
member.returns: SMTP_OK if successful. Otherwise, Email Return Error Code is returned. Negative return error codes indicate that no part of the email was sent. Positive return error codes indicate a failure, but the email was still sent. In the event of more than one failure, the return error code of the first failure is returned.

member.summary: Gets the ServerBinding instance. In most cases, the IPv4 ServerBinding instance is returned.

member.summary: Gets the IPv4 ServerBinding instance. The returned instance can be used to fine-tune the IPv4 server endpoint.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.BindingV6
member.summary: Gets the IPv6 ServerBinding instance. The returned instance can be used to fine-tune the IPv6 server endpoint.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.BindV6
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether the server should listen for IPv6 connections. Setting this flag doesn't have any immediate effect. Its value is used only when the server is opened (either by setting the Active property to true or by directly calling the Open method).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.BindV4
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether the server should listen for IPv4 connections. Setting this flag doesn't have any immediate effect. It's value is used only when the server is opened (either by setting the Active property to true or by directly calling the Open method).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port number on which the server will listen.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.CloseConnectionsOnShutdown
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether the currently open client connections should be appropriately closed on server shutdown. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.EnableNagle
member.summary: Gets or the sets flag indicating whether the Nagle's algorithm should be used. Setting this flag doesn't have any immediate effect. Its value is used only when the server is opened (either by setting the Active property to true or by directly calling the Open method).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.DefaultPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the default port number.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.ConnectionClass
member.summary: Gets or sets an alternative Connection class to be used for incoming data connections. The class described by the assigned Type must be a descendant of the Connection class, and will be used for all connections that are established after the property has been set. Existing connections are not affected by changing the property. If the ConnectionType property value is null (default), instances of the Connection base class will be used.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.ConnectionFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets an alternative Connection factory instance to be used for incoming data connections. This factory will be used to create corresponding Connection instances for all connections that are established after the property has been set. Existing connections are not affected by changing the property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag defining whether the server is listening for incoming connections. Setting this property to true or false calls the Open or Close methods, accordingly.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.EthernetAdapterToBindTo
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to bind to a specific adapter This is valid on systems which support multiple adapters. Ignored on systems which do not support multiple adapters. Only valid if the address of the HTTP server is defined as 0.0.0.0 - Ignored otherwise Set to EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter if no specific binding is required. On units which just have a single adapter - we can accept a connection from anywhere - In this case this setting is ignored On units which have multiple adapters - If the user specified EthernetCSAdapter then accept connection from Control Subnet side only - If the user specified EthernetLAN2Adapter then accept connection from LAN2 side only - If the user specified EthernetLANAdapter, then accept connections from anywhere but from the Control subnet side and LAN2

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.TimeoutEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the default TimeoutEnabled value for all newly created Connections.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Server.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the default Timeout value for all newly created Connections.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default MaxLineLengthEnabled value for all newly created Connections.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default MaxLineLength value for all newly created Connections.

member.summary: Check if the IP is blocked. If it is, then we return false here. If it isn't blocked, then we return true.
member.returns: true, if IP is fine. False, if the IP is blocked

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.EthernetAdapterFiguringOutClass.AreWeOnTheRightEthernetAdapter(System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.String,Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAdapterType,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if we are receving an connection on the right ethernet adapter, if we are, everything is fine, and we can continue the connection This function is used for all server instances that are listening for connections. Depending on how they are configured, and what types of adapters are plugged in and licenced, the server will either accept or reject the connection
member.returns: true, if we are on the right ethernet adapter; false if we aren't

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.WaitForConnection
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a blocking call and will block until a connection is made or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnection multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating success or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.WaitForConnection(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a blocking call and will block until a connection is made or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnection multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating success or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.WaitForConnectionAsync(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServerClientConnectCallback)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a non blocking call. The call will check for the parameters and will start an asynchronous operation. The callback gets invoked when the connection succeeds or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnectionAsync multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.param: Callback invoked when the client gets connected or an error occurred.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating socket operation pending or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.WaitForConnectionAsync(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServerClientConnectCallbackEx,System.Object)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a non blocking call. The call will check for the parameters and will start an asynchronous operation. The callback gets invoked when the connection succeeds or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnectionAsync multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.param: Callback invoked when the client gets connected or an error occurred.
User specified callback object passed to the callback
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating socket operation pending or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.WaitForConnection(System.String)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server from the specified address. This is a blocking call and will block until a connection is made or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnection multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.param: Specific IP Address or '0.0.0.0' to accept a connection from any IP Address.
member.returns: Socket Error Code indicating success or failure.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.TCPServer.EthernetAdapterToBindTo
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to bind to a specific adapter This is valid on systems which support multiple adapters. Ignored on systems which do not support multiple adapters. Only valid if the address of the TCP server is defined as 0.0.0.0 - Ignored otherwise Set to EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter if no specific binding is required. On units which just have a single adapter - we can accept a connection from anywhere - In this case this setting is ignored On units which have multiple adapters - If the user specified EthernetCSAdapter then accept connection from Control Subnet side only - If the user specified EthernetLAN2Adapter then accept connection from LAN2 side only - If the user specified EthernetLANAdapter, then accept connections from anywhere but from the Control subnet side and LAN2

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer
member.summary: Multiple client Secure TCP Server class SecureTcpServer requires firmware version 1.500.0005 or above If no user certificate is provided, the SecureTcpServer will use the SSL state of the control system to determine which certificate to use. i.e. SSL Self will use the self signed certificate of the control system. SSL must be enabled on the controller.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.WaitForConnection
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a blocking call and will block until a connection is made or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnection multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating success or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.WaitForConnection(System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a blocking call and will block until a connection is made or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnection multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating success or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.WaitForConnectionAsync(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServerClientConnectCallback)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a non blocking call. The call will check for the parameters and will start an asynchronous operation. The callback gets invoked when the connection succeeds or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnectionAsync multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.param: Callback invoked when the client gets connected or an error occurred.
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating socket operation pending or an error

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.WaitForConnectionAsync(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServerClientConnectCallbackEx,System.Object)
member.summary: Function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a non blocking call. The call will check for the parameters and will start an asynchronous operation. The callback gets invoked when the connection succeeds or an error occurs. Invoking WaitForConnectionAsync multiple times will throw a SOCKET_MAX_CONNECTIONS_REACHED error, if the server already has the max number of connections active as specified by the MaxNumberOfClientSupported property.
member.param: Callback invoked when the client gets connected or an error occurred.
User specified callback object passed to the callback
member.returns: SocketErrorCode indicating socket operation pending or an error

member.param: Specific IP Address or '0.0.0.0' to accept a connection from any IP Address.
member.returns: Socket Error Code indicating success or failure.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.MakeConnection(System.String,System.UInt32@,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServerClientConnectCallback)
member.summary: Private function to accept an incoming connection on the server. This is a blocking call. This invokes the callback once a connection gets established The callback needs to exit or else this function will not return.
member.param: Specific IP Address or '0.0.0.0' to accept a connection from any IP Address.
Client Index for the connected socket.
Callback invoked when the client gets connected.
member.returns: Socket Error Code indicating success or failure.
member.exception: If a user certificate and key are provided with the SetServerCertificate and SetServerPrivateKey functions, respectively, and there is an issue with the formatting and/or parsing, this exception will be thrown. Also, if a user certificate and key aren't provided when the SSL mode of the controller is OFF, there is no certificate on the control system to use, and thus an exception will be thrown.

member.summary: Indicates the state of the server

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.HandshakeTimeout
member.summary: Property to set the SSL Handshake timeout in seconds. This controls the maximum time allowed for the SSL handshake to complete before the socket is closed. The default timeout is which means that the SSL handshake process will block forever. The range of permitted values is 30 seconds to .
member.exception: Timeout cannot be less then 30 seconds

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.SocketSendOrReceiveTimeOutInMs
member.summary: Timeout period in milli second for socket send or receive

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.PortNumber
member.summary: Port Number for the server port

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.MaxNumberOfClientSupported
member.summary: Max number of clients supported

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.NumberOfClientsConnected
member.summary: Indicates number of clients connected at the current time. This will return -1 if we are unable to get the count.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.Nagle
member.summary: Gets or Sets the current state of the Nagle Algorithm for the server socket Enabling Nagle will delay when send or receive buffers are not full. Note: Nagle is not enabled by default.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.m_iSocketStatusChange
member.summary: Socket status change event that is fired when the status changes

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.SocketStatusChange
member.summary: Event triggered when the status of the socket changes

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.EthernetAdapterToBindTo
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to bind to a specific adapter This is valid on systems which support multiple adapters. Ignored on systems which do not support multiple adapters. Only valid if the address of the TCP server is defined as 0.0.0.0 - Ignored otherwise Set to EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter if no specific binding is required. On units which just have a single adapter - we can accept a connection from anywhere - In this case this setting is ignored On units which have multiple adapters - If the user specified EthernetCSAdapter then accept connection from Control Subnet side only - If the user specified EthernetLAN2Adapter then accept connection from LAN2 side only - If the user specified EthernetLANAdapter, then accept connections from anywhere but from the Control subnet side and LAN2

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.LocalAddressServerAcceptedConnectionFrom
member.summary: Local Address of server that accepted a connection. This assumes a single client is connected to the server and returns the local address of that server connection.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.AddressServerAcceptedConnectionFrom
member.summary: Address of the client which got connected to the server. This assumes a single client is connected to the server and returns the address of that client

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.PortNumberServerAcceptedConnectionFrom
member.summary: Source Port number of the client which got connected to the server. This assumes a single client is connected to the server and returns the source port number of that client

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.IncomingDataBuffer
member.summary: Incoming data buffer for the client connected to the server This assumes a single connection to the TCP Server

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.SecureTCPServer.ServerSocketStatus
member.summary: Function to get a socket status This assumes a single client is connected to the server and returns the address of that client
member.returns: Socket status ...

member.summary: Indicates whether data is available on the client to be read. This assumes a single client is connected to the server and returns true if there is data which can be read from that specific client.

member.summary: Returns the Ethernet adapter on which the socket resides EthernetAdapterType.EthernetLANAdapter indicates that the socket is on the LAN Adapter EthernetAdapterType.EthernetCSAdapter indicates the Control Subnet side (for a system with a router) EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter indicates that the socket is not initialized as yet EthernetAdapterType.EthernetLAN2Adapter indicates the second LAN Adapter

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.UDPServer.EthernetAdapterToBindTo
member.summary: Indicates if the user wants to bind to a specific adapter This is valid on systems which support multiple adapters. Undefined on systems which do not support multiple adapters. Only valid if the address of the UDP server is defined as 0.0.0.0/255.255.255.255/ Multicast socket - Ignored otherwise. Set to EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter if no specific binding is required.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.UDPServer.IPAddressLastMessageReceivedFrom
member.summary: String indicating the source address that the last UDP Packet was received from. Valid only after a packet has been received from the remote side. Used within the SendDataEx function to send data back to the remote endpoint where the last data was received from. This will return String.Empty if no packet has been received from the remote end

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronSockets.UDPServer.IPPortLastMessageReceivedFrom
member.summary: This indicates source port that the last UDP Packet was received from. Valid only after a packet has been received from the remote side. Used within the SendDataEx function to send data back to the remote endpoint where the last data was received from.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery
member.summary: Ethernet Autodiscovery class

member.summary: Prevent concurrent access to the AD functions

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.Query
member.summary: Function to initiate an Autodiscovery query on all the adapters. Will populate the DiscoveredElementsList. This function needs to be invoked before a call can be made to any of the autodiscovery related functions.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.Query(Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAdapterType)
member.summary: Function to initiate an Autodiscovery query on the specified adapter. Will populate the DiscoveredElementsList. This function needs to be invoked before a call can be made to any of the autodiscovery related functions. The parameter is only supported on firmware version 1.502.0018 and higher.
member.param: Indicates which adapter to query. The valid values are for LAN side , for CS side and for both sides. is the default value. This value is only used for a unit with a router. For all other units this value is ignored.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.GetDeviceElementForSpecifiedAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Function to return the device element at the specified IP Address
member.returns: Element in the discovered list corresponding to the specified address or NULL
member.remarks: Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.GetDeviceElementForSpecifiedHostName(System.String)
member.summary: Function to return the device element with the specified hostname
member.returns: Element in the discovered list corresponding to the specified address or NULL
member.remarks: Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.SetIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDevice(Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.AutoDiscoveredDeviceElement,System.UInt16,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to set the IP Id on the specified device.
member.param: Specific device within the discovered list
New IP Id to set the device to. Adds/Modifies an entry within the IPTable on the device

Timeout in ms for the device the respond to the autodiscovery command. This call will block until the timeout expires or the device responds to the autodiscovery. 0 specifies no timeout. Infinite specifies call will block until the device responds to the autodiscovery request.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors Enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Call will return when we invoke the stop function / timeout expires / device responds to the autodiscovery command. Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.LightSpecifiedDevice(Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.AutoDiscoveredDeviceElement,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to light the specified device.This will help the user to locate a specific device
member.param: Specific device within the discovered list

Timeout in ms for the device the respond to the autodiscovery command. This call will block until the timeout expires or the device responds to the autodiscovery. 0 specifies no timeout. Infinite specifies call will block until the device responds to the autodiscovery request.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors Enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Call will return when we invoke the stop function / timeout expires / device responds to the autodiscovery command. This requires a minimum firmware version of 1.011.0011 and higher. Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.ClearIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDevice(Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.AutoDiscoveredDeviceElement)
member.summary: Function to clear the IP table entry on the specified device.
member.param: Specific device within the discovered list
member.returns: Boolean indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.SetIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDeviceType(System.String,System.UInt16,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to set the IP Id on any device of the specified type. This will force all devices of the specified type into the light and poll mode
member.param: New IP Id to set the device to. Adds/Modifies an entry within the IPTable on the device

Timeout in ms for the device the respond to the autodiscovery command. This call will block until the timeout expires or the device responds to the autodiscovery. 0 specifies no timeout. Infinite specifies call will block until the device responds to the autodiscovery request.
If set to true will not force all devices into light and poll mode if the specified device type is not found. This requires firmware version 1.013.0000 and higher.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Call will return when we invoke the stop function / timeout expires / device responds to the autodiscovery command. Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.SetIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDeviceType(System.String,System.UInt16,System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to set the IP Id on any device of the specified type. This will force all devices of the specified type into the light and poll mode
member.param: New IP Id to set the device to. Adds/Modifies an entry within the IPTable on the device

Timeout in ms for the device the respond to the autodiscovery command. This call will block until the timeout expires or the device responds to the autodiscovery. 0 specifies no timeout. Infinite specifies call will block until the device responds to the autodiscovery request.
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Call will return when we invoke the stop function / timeout expires / device responds to the autodiscovery command. Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.ClearIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDeviceType(System.String)
member.summary: Function to clear the IP Table Entry on the specified device defined by the device Type
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.ForceIPTableEntryOnSpecifiedDeviceType(System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Function to force the IPTableEntry on the specified device defined by the device type
member.param: New IP Id to set the device to. Adds/Modifies an entry within the IPTable on the device
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Forces an iptable entry on the device of the specified type. Invoke the "Query" function to populate the discovered element list.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.StopLightAndPoll
member.summary: Function to stop the Autodiscovery functionality on the controller
member.returns: eAutoDiscoveryErrors enum indicating failure or success

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.SetHostNameOnSpecifiedDevice(Crestron.SimplSharp.EthernetAutodiscovery.AutoDiscoveredDeviceElement,System.String)
member.summary: Function to set the hostname on the specified device
member.param: Specific device within the discovered list
New hostname to set on the device

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.Connect
member.summary: This method establishes connection to websocket server
member.returns: it returns WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS if connection was established
member.exception: Object has been disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.ConnectEx
member.summary: This method establishes connection to websocket server. Same as Connect(), with the following additional parameters: Origin, Protocol, AddOnHeader. If Origin and Protocol are defined and not null they will passed on to the server. Some servers require the Origin be defined to block unauthorized access. The AddOnHeader is used for custom HTTP header which must comply with HTTP header specification RFC 2616 and Websocket specification RFC6455, for example "Protocol: Chat V3.0". This method requires minimum firmware version 1.012.0007.
member.returns: it returns WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS if connection was established
member.exception: Object has been disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.ConnectAsyncCB(System.UInt32,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_RESULT_CODES)
member.summary: This method is called by the websocket library after the websocket connection process is ended
member.param: error code is set to WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS if connection was successful
member.returns: returns WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS on success

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.ConnectAsync
member.summary: This method posts a request for connection to websocket server. When the server connection is established the callback method gets called.
member.returns: returns WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS on success
member.exception: Object has been disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.ConnectAsyncEx
member.summary: This method posts a request for connection to websocket server. When the server connection is established the callback method gets called. This method supports the Websocket header commands Origin, Protocol and additional user defined header commands. This method requires minimum firmware version 1.012.0007.
member.returns: returns WEBSOCKET_CLIENT_SUCCESS on success
member.exception: Object has been disposed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.KeepAlive
member.summary: Setting to true will include the "Keep-Alive" token in the "Connection" header of the websocket handshake. Otherwise will not include the token.
member.remarks: Note: Crestron defaults KeepAlive to true. We have noticed some servers do not handle this correctly. Please check with your server and try setting KeepAlive to false when encountering issues connecting. This property is only supported in Firmware Version v1.501.0035 or above.

member.exception: This exception is thrown if URL has invalid value

member.summary: Set/Get Host is used in the Host field of the WebSocket handshake header. Do not add carriage return and line feed.
member.remarks: Host is only supported in Firmware Version v1.501.0035 or above.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.AddOnHeader
member.summary:
Set/Get Add Websocket header string, must include proper websocket command settings. Each command must be followed by a colon, value and ended with carriage return line feed. The last command must NOT end with carriage return line feed.
Example: Origin: HTTP://www.test.com \r\n Protocol: SuperChat
