member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.EthernetAdapter
member.summary: Returns the Ethernet adapter on which the socket resides EthernetAdapterType.EthernetLANAdapter indicates that the socket is on the LAN Adapter EthernetAdapterType.EthernetCSAdapter indicates the Control Subnet side (for a system with a router) EthernetAdapterType.EthernetUnknownAdapter indicates that the socket is not initialized as yet EthernetAdapterType.EthernetLAN2Adapter indicates the second LAN Adapter

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS
member.summary: Enumerations of possible reasons for closing the websocket

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_NORMAL_CLOSE
member.summary: 1000 indicates a normal closure, meaning that the purpose for which the connection was established has been fulfilled.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_SERVER_OR_BORWSER_GOINGAWAY
member.summary: 1001 indicates that an endpoint is "going away", such as a server going down or a browser having navigated away from a page.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_PROTOCOL_ERROR
member.summary: 1002 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_ON_INVALID_DATA
member.summary: 1003 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data it cannot accept (e.g., an endpoint that understands only text data MAY send this if it receives a binary message).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_FUTURE
member.summary: 1004 Reserved. The specific meaning might be defined in the future.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_NOSTATUS_CODE_PRESENT
member.summary: 1005 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that no status code was actually present.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_ABNORMAL_CONNECTION_CLOSING
member.summary: 1006 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that the connection was closed abnormally, e.g., without sending or receiving a Close control frame.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_INCONSISTENT_MESSAGE_RCVED
member.summary: 1007 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received data within a message that was not consistent with the type of the message (e.g., non-UTF-8 [RFC3629] data within a text message).

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_MSG_RCVED_VIOLATING_POLICY
member.summary: 1008 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy. This is a generic status code that can be returned when there is no other more suitable status code (e.g., 1003 or 1009) or if there is a need to hide specific details about the policy.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_BIG_MSG_RCVED
member.summary: 1009 indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big for it to process.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_PROPER_EXTENSION_REPLY_NOT_RCVED
member.summary: 1010 indicates that an endpoint (client) is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server didnt return them in the response message of the WebSocket handshake.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_ENCOUNTERED_UNEXPECTED_CONDITION
member.summary: 1011 indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_CLOSE_REASONS.WEBSOCKET_CLOSING_TLS_HANDSHAKE_ERROR
member.summary: 1015 is a reserved value and MUST NOT be set as a status code in a Close control frame by an endpoint. It is designated for use in applications expecting a status code to indicate that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake (e.g., the server certificate cant be verified).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_PACKET_TYPES
member.summary: Enumerations of websocket packet types

member.summary: continuation packet

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_PACKET_TYPES.LWS_WS_OPCODE_07__TEXT_FRAME
member.summary: text packet type

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_PACKET_TYPES.LWS_WS_OPCODE_07__BINARY_FRAME
member.summary: binary packet type

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronWebSocketClient.WebSocketClient.WEBSOCKET_PACKET_TYPES.LWS_WS_OPCODE_07__CLOSE
member.summary: packet close control opcode

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronEnvironment.SetDate(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Function to change the current date of the system.
member.param: The month to which the date is set. Valid range is 1 through 12, corresponding to January through December.
The dat of the month to which to date is set. The range varies from month to month, but always starts at 1 and does not go above 31.
The year to which the date is set. The year is four digits, i.e. 2006.
member.exception: One of the parameters is outside the valid range.
Setting the date is not supported in this environment.

members.member:
Set the system time and date
The hour portion of the time to set the system time to. Valid range is from 0 to 23. The minutes portion of the time to set the system time to. Valid range is from 0 to 59. The seconds portion of the time to set the system time to. Valid range is from 0 to 59. The month to which the date is set. Valid range is 1 through 12, corresponding to January through December. The dat of the month to which to date is set. The range varies from month to month, but always starts at 1 and does not go above 31. The year to which the date is set. The year is four digits, i.e. 2006. One of the parameters is outside the valid range./// Setting the time and date are not supported in this environment.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronEnvironment.Latitude
member.summary: Property to set the latitude which is used by the native scheduling engine for the astronomical events. The Set feature is not supported on . It will throw a . This property requires a reboot for it to take into effect. This property is read on startup and could be out of sync if it was changed and the unit was not rebooted. This defaults to 41.000000 North
member.exception: Valid values are -90.0 to 90.0
Unable to set Latitude.
Operation is not supported

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronEnvironment.Longitude
member.summary: Property to set the longitude which is used by the native scheduling engine for the astronomical events. The Set feature is not supported on . It will throw a . This property requires a reboot for it to take into effect. This property is read on startup and could be out of sync if it was changed and the unit was not rebooted. This defaults to -73.933333 West
member.exception: Valid values are -180.0 to 180.0
Unable to set Longitude.
Operation is not supported

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.Query
member.summary: Function to report all the cresnet devices in the system. This might not work if there are devices with duplicate Id's on the network. Please execute the function to detect if there are duplicate Id's on your network.
member.remarks: On a successful response, the will contain all devices available in the system. The list will be empty if there are no devices in the system. if the function returns a , then one of the reasons could be that there are duplicate Id's on your network. In that case please execute the function.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value
member.exception: Cresnet is not supported on this platform. Use to determine the running platform type.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.ParseString(System.String@,System.Byte@,System.String@,System.UInt32@,System.String@)
member.summary: Method to parse the string... this is only used for the ReportCresnet currently and not for PPNDIscover

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.ReportDevices
member.summary: Function to report the cresnet devices present in the system. If there are multiple devices at the same Id, then this will just report the first device. Use the DiscoverAllDevices to discover all the cresnet devices (including duplicate Id's) in the system.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.DiscoverAllDevices
member.summary: Function to discover all the devices in the system. This will report devices with duplicate Id's also. This will not report any cresnet devices which are in the loader. Please execute the function to detect those devices.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value
member.exception: Cresnet is not supported on this platform. Use to determine the running platform type.

member.summary: Function to discover all the devices in the system. This will report devices with duplicate Id's also. This will not report any cresnet devices which are in the loader. Please execute the function to detect those devices.

member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.Serialization.CrestronXMLSerialization.SerializeObject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Function to convert public fields and properties of an object to an XML file.
member.remarks: The following types can not be serialized, arrays of ArrayList or arrays of List(Of T). Also, enumerations of type unsigned long that contains values larger then 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 can not be serialized.
member.param: File to serialize the object to. If the file already exists it will be replaced.
Object to serialize to the specified file.
member.exception: Error while attempting to serialize the object.
The location of the specified file is invalid.
The specified file name is null(or empty) or the objectToSerialize parameter is null.

member.param: Stream to serialize the object to.
Object to serialize to the specified stream.
member.exception: Error while attempting to serialize the object.
The specified stream is null(or empty) or the objectToSerialize parameter is null.

member.summary: Represents a local socket binding. All active socket connections are "bound" to a specific port on the client and server side. These bindings are particularly important for some protocols to identify the local connection. Server processes bind themselves to a specific port in order to service incoming queries.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.DisableAuthenticationOnCSOnLinux(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: DisableAuthenticationOnCSOnLinux - disables authentication on the box
member.param: disable ssl also - return value will indicate reboot required
clear out all the users also

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.EnableAuthenticationOnCSOnLinux(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: EnableAuthenticationOnCSOnLinux - Enables authentication with the given username and password
member.returns: Returns eAuthenticationEnabledDisabledResponse which indicates error/success or reboot required

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.Enable(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to enable authentication on the control system.
member.remarks:
If SSL is not enabled, it will be after calling this method.
A reboot maybe required to complete this operation.
member.param: User name of either an existing administrator or, if none exist, the user name of the default account.
Password of the existing account specified by the 'adminUserName' parameter, or the password of the default account.
member.returns: Result enumeration to determine if the operation was successful or not.
member.exception: This method is currently not supported.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.Disable(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.UserToken)
member.summary:
Method to disable authentication on the control system.
SSL state and user information will remain in their current state.
member.returns: Result enumeration to determine if the operation was successful or not.
member.exception: This method is currently not supported.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.Disable(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.UserToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to disable authentication on the control system.
member.param: 'true' will disable SSL, 'false' will not change the state of SSL.
member.returns: Result enumeration to determine if the operation was successful or not.
member.exception: This method is currently not supported.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.Disable(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronAuthentication.Authentication.UserToken,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to disable authentication on the control system.
member.param: 'true' will disable SSL, 'false' will not change the state of SSL.
'true' will remove all users from the system, 'false' current user accounts will remain untouched on the system.
member.returns: Result enumeration to determine if the operation was successful or not.
member.exception: This method is currently not supported.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.BigInteger.TryParse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.BigInteger@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the string representation of a number in a specified style and culture-specific format to its System.Numerics.BigInteger equivalent, and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: The string representation of a number. The string is interpreted using the style specified by style.
A bitwise combination of enumeration values that indicates the style elements that can be present in value. A typical value to specify is System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Integer.
An object that supplies culture-specific formatting information about value.

When this method returns, contains the System.Numerics.BigInteger equivalent to the number that is contained in value, or System.Numerics.BigInteger.Zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the value parameter is null or is not in a format that is compliant with style. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the value parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.BigInteger.TryParse(System.String,Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.BigInteger@)
member.summary: Tries to convert the string representation of a number to its System.Numerics.BigInteger equivalent, and returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: The string representation of a number.

When this method returns, contains the System.Numerics.BigInteger equivalent to the number that is contained in value, or zero (0) if the conversion fails. The conversion fails if the value parameter is null or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if value was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Listener
member.summary: The Listener class is used internally by the Server component. For each port binding, one or more Listener instances are created. Each runs in a separate thread and listens for incoming connections. As soon as a connection is accepted, a Worker thread is created to handle this data connection, and then, the Listener thread goes back to listening for new connections.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.ContentBytes
member.summary: Returns the HTTPs body in form of a byte array. Retrieving the content of a response from a server reads all of the data and is a mutually exclusive operation, therefore calling ContentBytes or ContentString after retrieving the ContentStream and reading its contents will yield an empty response.
member.returns: Bytes in content or null

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.ContentStream
member.summary: Returns a Stream object with the HTTPs body of the received request (server) or response (client). Because ContentStream provides you with direct access to the underlying Connection Stream, it is the fastest and most efficient way to access the response (as opposed to ContentString and ContentBytes, both of which involve copying the entire data from the stream into a memory buffer). Retrieving the content of a response from a server reads all of the data and is a mutually exclusive operation, therefore attempting to read from the ContentStream after retrieving the ContentBytes or ContentString will yield an empty response body.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.ContentString
member.summary: Returns the HTTPs body in form of a String object. Retrieving the content of a response from a server reads all of the data and is a mutually exclusive operation, therefore calling ContentBytes or ContentString after retrieving the ContentStream and reading its contents will yield an empty response.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.HasContentLength
member.summary: Specifies whether the HTTPs header provides a ContentLength field or a transfer-encoding of chunked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: Contains the ContentLength header value received from the remote side. If the remote did not provide a length (for example in HTTP 1.0 scenarios, or if Keep-Alive is not supported), accessing the property will raise an exception. Use the HasContentLength property to determine if a valid ContentLength has been received.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsIncomingRequestResponse.KeepAlive
member.summary: Keeps the HTTPs Request Response connection alive. If enabled (true) , once a request is made and a connection is established, this connection is kept open and used for future requests. If disabled, the connection is closed, and a new connection is created for future requests.

member.returns: HttpClient Response

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.BeginGetRequestStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HTTPStreamRequestCallbackEx,Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClientRequest,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a Stream object to use to write data.
member.param: The state object for this request
member.exception: Invalid operation
member.returns: updated request
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
Request must be in new request state
member.remarks: The BeginGetRequestStream method requires some synchronous setup tasks to complete (DNS resolution, proxy detection, and TCP socket connection, for example) before this method becomes asynchronous. As a result, this method should never be called on a user interface (UI) thread because it might take considerable time (up to several minutes depending on network settings) to complete the initial synchronous setup tasks before an exception for an error is thrown or the method succeeds.
member.note: Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request. If you call the BeginGetRequestStream method, you must use the BeginGetResponse method to retrieve the response.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.EndGetRequestStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClientRequest,System.Object)
member.summary: Supply the stream interface
member.returns: The Input Stream
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: You must set the value of the ContentLength property before EndGetRequestStream.
You must call the Stream.Close method to close the stream and release the connection for reuse. Failure to close the stream causes your application to run out of connections.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.BeginGetResponseStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HTTPStreamResponseCallbackEx,Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClientRequest,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous response for a Stream object to use to read data.
member.param: The state object for this request
member.returns: The asynchronous request for a response.
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: The BeginGetResponse method starts an asynchronous request for a response from the Internet resource. The asynchronous callback method uses the EndGetResponse method to return the actual WebResponse.
member.example: // Start the asynchronous operation to get the response request.ThisClient.BeginGetResponseStream(new HTTPStreamResponseCallbackEx(GetResponseCallback), request, status);

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.EndGetResponseStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClientRequest)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous request to an Internet resource
member.returns: A WebResponse that contains the response from the Internet resource.
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: The EndGetResponse method completes an asynchronous request for an Internet resource that was started by calling the BeginGetResponse method. Note: You must call the Close method to close the stream and release the connection. Failure to do so may cause your application to run out of connections.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.Dispatch(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClientRequest)
member.summary: One of the core methods of the HttpClient class. This method uses the HttpClientRequest class to send messages to the server and the HttpClientResponse to receive server answers. Uses the TryDispatch method to send data and raises an HttpException exception if any errors occurs.
member.exception: Thrown if any Http errors occur
Thrown if an unexpected error occurs
member.returns: HttpClient Response

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.KeepAlive
member.summary: Controls whether to use HTTP Keep-Alive to keep the connection alive between requests. If enabled (true) , once a request is made and a connection is established, this connection is kept open and used for future requests. If disabled, the connection is closed, and a new connection is created for future requests.
member.remarks: Default value is true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.ProcessBusy
member.summary: If using commands with callbacks, check this busy flag before using another command (Dispatch, Get, Post, etc.)

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom connection pool. This property is inherited from the Client class.

member.summary: Enables or disables connection pooling.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the software being used to retrieve data via the URL. Some custom HTTP servers check this HTTP header to provide content optimized for particular HTTP browsers.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.Accept
member.summary: Gets or sets content types that are acceptable for the response. The default value is "text/html, image/gif, image/jpeg, image/png, */*".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time (in seconds) that a client will wait for a server response within a single request. The default value is 60 seconds (1 minute). The timeout handling can be activated via the TimeoutEnabled property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.TimeoutEnabled
member.summary: This property controls whether the request operation will do an automatic timeout checking. If timeout handling is turned on (i.e. this property is set to true) and a request takes longer than Timeout, it will be terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.UserName
member.summary: Name that will be inserted into the Authorization HTTP header in the request to the server.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.Password
member.summary: Password that will be inserted into the Authorization HTTP header in the request to the server.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpClient.MaximumAutomaticRedirections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of redirects that the request follows. Default Value: 20

member.summary: DNS Lookup class

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.DnsLookup.ResolveFirst(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the given host name and returns the first IP address that matches it. If the host could not be resolved, a DnsResolveException is thrown.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.DnsLookup.ResolveRandom(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the given host name and - if multiple IP Addresses are available - returns a random IP address from the list. This can be used in load balancing scenarios to hit a random of several available hosts. If the host could not be resolved, a DnsResolveException is thrown.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.DnsLookup.ResolveAll(System.String)
member.summary: ResolveAll returns an array with all IP addresses for the given host name. In load balancing scenarios, several IP addresses can be provided in the DNS servers for the same host name. If the host name could not be resolved, an empty array is returned. To retrieve one specific IP address, you will usually use ResolveFirst or ResolveAll.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.DnsLookup.TryStringAsIPAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Try to resolve the input parameter string as an IP address.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.DnsLookup.ReverseResolve(System.Net.IPAddress)

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.GetFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the remote file pointed by URL. This method directly uses the URL supplied. The URL is retrieved to the destination (localPath) file. Port number can be embedded into URL. Some examples of valid URL prefixed with the specified protocol - http://host.com/myPath/MyFile.txt, https://host.com/myPath/MyFile.txt, ftp://host.com:21/myPath/MyFile.txt, etc.
member.param: The URL to the file intended for downloading
The fully qualified local path to the file being downloaded starting with initial "/"
member.returns: Zero if successful. -1 if underlying object has not been properly initialized. 1 if internal error occurred. Use GetLastClientError() to retrieve the error code. 87 if invalid parameter was passed.
member.remarks: Non-ASCII characters are not currently supported.
member.exception: The FTC Client has already been closed or disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.PutFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Uploads local file to the remote destination pointed by URL. This method directly uses the URL supplied. Port number can be embedded into URL. Some examples of valid URL prefixed with the specified protocol - http://host.com/myPath/MyFile.txt, https://host.com/myPath/MyFile.txt, ftp://host.com:21/myPath/MyFile.txt, etc.
member.param: The URL to the file intended for uploading
The fully qualified local path to the file being uploaded starting with initial "/"
member.returns: Zero if successful. -1 if underlying object has not been properly initialized. 1 if internal error occurred. Use GetLastClientError() to retrieve the error code. 87 if invalid parameter was passed.
member.remarks: Non-ASCII characters are not currently supported.
member.exception: The FTC Client has already been closed or disposed.

member.summary: Uploads local file to the remote destination pointed by URL.
member.returns: Returns status of file posting.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.SetPeerVerification(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set option to enable/disable verification of the peer's certificate.
member.param: The Boolean turning On/Off the Verification.
member.returns: Zero if successful. -1 if underlying object has not been properly initialized. 1 if internal error occurred. Use GetLastClientError() to retrieve the error code. 87 if invalid parameter was passed.
member.remarks: This option determines whether the client verifies the authenticity of the peer's certificate. When negotiating a SSL connection, the server sends a certificate indicating its identity. Client verifies whether the certificate is authentic, i.e. that you can trust that the server is who the certificate says it is. This trust is based on a chain of digital signatures, rooted in certification authority (CA) certificates you supply. Client will use certificates provided with the SetCACertificate method. When the Verification is set to TRUE, and the verification fails to prove that the certificate is authentic, the GetFile method fails. When it is FALSE, the peer certificate verification succeeds regardless. Authenticating the certificate is not by itself very useful. You typically want to ensure that the server, as authentically identified by its certificate, is the server you mean to be talking to. Use SetHostVerification to control that. The check that the host name in the certificate is valid for the host name you're connecting to is done independently of the SetPeerVerification option.
member.exception: The FTC Client has already been closed or disposed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.SetHostVerification(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set option to enable/disable host name verification.
member.param: The Boolean turning On/Off the Verification.
member.returns: Zero if successful. -1 if underlying object has not been properly initialized. 1 if internal error occurred. Use GetLastClientError() to retrieve the error code. 87 if invalid parameter was passed.
member.remarks: When negotiating a SSL connection, the server sends a certificate indicating its identity. When SetHostVerification is TRUE, then certificate must indicate that the server is the server to which you meant to connect, or the connection fails. Curl considers the server the intended one when the Common Name field or a Subject Alternate Name field in the certificate matches the host name in the URL to which you told Curl to connect. When the value is FALSE, the connection succeeds regardless of the names in the certificate. The default value for this option is TRUE. This option controls checking the server's certificate's claimed identity. The server could be lying. To control lying, see SetPeerVerification method.
member.exception: The FTC Client has already been closed or disposed.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod
member.summary: The method of authentication to a proxy or an http server

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.NONE
member.summary: No authentication method defined = default (BASIC)

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.BASIC
member.summary: HTTP Basic authentication. This is the default choice, and the only method that is in wide-spread use and supported virtually everywhere. This sends the user name and password over the network in plain text, easily captured by others.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.DIGEST
member.summary: HTTP Digest authentication. Digest authentication is defined in RFC 2617 and is a more secure way to do authentication over public networks than the regular old-fashioned Basic method.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.DIGEST_IE
member.summary: HTTP Digest authentication with an IE flavor. Digest authentication is defined in RFC 2617 and is a more secure way to do authentication over public networks than the regular old-fashioned Basic method.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.NEGOTIATE
member.summary: HTTP Negotiate (SPNEGO) authentication. Negotiate authentication is defined in RFC 4559 and is the most secure way to perform authentication over HTTP.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.NTLM
member.summary: HTTP NTLM authentication. A proprietary protocol invented and used by Microsoft. It uses a challenge-response and hash concept similar to Digest, to prevent the password from being eavesdropped.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.NTLM_WB
member.summary: NTLM delegating to winbind helper. Authentication is performed by a separate binary application that is executed when needed. The name of the application is specified at compile time but is typically /usr/bin/ntlm_auth

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.ANY
member.summary: This is a convenience macro that sets all bits and thus makes the client pick any it finds suitable. The client will automatically select the one it finds most secure.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.ANYSAFE
member.summary: This is a convenience macro that sets all bits except Basic and thus makes the client pick any it finds suitable. The client will automatically select the one it finds most secure.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronFileTransferClient.FTCAuthMethod.ONLY
member.summary: This is a meta symbol. OR this value together with a single specific auth value to force the client to probe for un-restricted auth and if not, only that single auth algorithm is acceptable.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.AsyncStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
buffer is null.
offset or count is negative
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.summary: Find the next record after this name in the Global DataStore and return the record information.
member.param: Input record name to find. Output the next record name. If name is an empty string, info on the first record will be returned.
member.returns: CDS_ERROR CDS_RECORD_NOT_FOUND - If name is not found or database is empty. CDS_END_OF_TABLE - If name is the last record or the output info is the last record. Note: CDS_END_OF_TABLE will be returned when "name" is the second to the last record. In this case "info" will be valid.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a Stream object to use to write data.
member.param: The state object for this request
member.exception: Invalid operation
member.returns: updated request
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
Request must be in new request state
member.note: Your application cannot mix synchronous and asynchronous methods for a particular request.
member.remarks: NOTE: This member function requires the use of facilities only available in firmware version 1.11 and higher.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.EndGetRequestStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClientRequest)
member.summary: Supply the stream interface
member.returns: The Input Stream
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: NOTE: This member function requires the use of facilities only available in firmware version 1.11 and higher.
You must set the value of the ContentLength property before EndGetRequestStream.
You must call the Stream.Close method to close the stream and release the connection for reuse. Failure to close the stream causes your application to run out of connections.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.BeginGetResponseStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsStreamResponseCallbackEx,Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClientRequest,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous response for a Stream object to use to read data.
member.param: The state object for this request
member.returns: An asynchronous request for a response.
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: NOTE: This member function requires the use of facilities only available in firmware version 1.11 and higher.
The BeginGetResponse method starts an asynchronous request for a response from the Internet resource. The asynchronous callback method uses the EndGetResponse method to return the actual WebResponse.
member.example: // Start the asynchronous operation to get the response request.ThisClient.BeginGetResponseStream(new HttpsStreamResponseCallbackEx(GetResponseCallback), request, status);

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.EndGetResponseStream(Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClientRequest)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronous request to an Internet resource
member.returns: A WebResponse that contains the response from the Internet resource.
member.exception: aRequest is NULL
No BeginRequest
member.remarks: NOTE: This member function requires the use of facilities only available in firmware version 1.11 and higher.

The EndGetResponse method completes an asynchronous request for an Internet resource that was started by calling the BeginGetResponse method. Note: You must call the Close method to close the stream and release the connection. Failure to do so may cause your application to run out of connections.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.UserObject
member.summary: Gets the last user specified Object for the Async operations on this HTTP Client instance. The return value will evaluate to null if Async operations with the object parameter are not utilized.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the software being used to retrieve data via the URL. Some custom HTTPS servers check this HTTPS header to provide content optimized for particular HTTPS browsers. Default Value: Crestron SimplSharp HTTPS Client

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.Accept
member.summary: Gets or sets content types that are acceptable for the response. The default value is "text/html, image/gif, image/jpeg, image/png".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time (in seconds) that a client will wait for a server response within a single request. The default value is 60 seconds (1 minute). The timeout handling can be activated via the TimeoutEnabled property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.TimeoutEnabled
member.summary: This property controls whether the request operation will do an automatic timeout checking. If timeout handling is turned on (i.e. this property is set to true) and a request takes longer than Timeout, it will be terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.UserName
member.summary: Name that will be inserted into the Authorization HTTPS header in the request to the server.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.Password
member.summary: Password that will be inserted into the Authorization HTTPS header in the request to the server.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.AllowAutoRedirect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the request should follow redirection responses. Default Value: true

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.MaximumAutomaticRedirections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of redirects that the request follows. Default Value: 20

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.Proxy
member.summary: Sets or gets proxy settings for the request. This property can be set to null. Default is null.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Https.HttpsClient.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Sets or gets the server authentication method to be used instead of the default one.
member.remarks: This is a bitmask, to tell the client which HTTP authentication method(s) you want it to use for your server authentication. If more than one bit is set, the client will first query the site to see what authentication methods it supports and then pick the best one you allow it to use.

member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the current stream and writes the data to buffer.

The byte offset in buffer at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.

offset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count.
The current stream instance is closed.

value is negative or is greater than the maximum length of the CrestronIO.MemoryStream, where the maximum length is(System.Int32.MaxValue - origin), and origin is the index into the underlying buffer at which the stream starts.

member.summary: Print messages only to the console. Not supported for .

member.summary: Log the messages only to the RM. Available for RM capable devices only.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer
member.summary: Compares nodes to determine whether they are equal

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer._nodeequalitycomparer
member.summary: The underlying System XNodeEqualityComparer

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new XNodeEqualityComparer instance

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer.Equals(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNode,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNode)
member.summary: Compares the values of two nodes
member.returns: true if the nodes are equal, false if otherwise
member.remarks: A null node is equal to another null node but unequal to a non-null node
Two XNode objects of different types are never equal
Two XText nodes are equal if they contain the same text

Two XElement nodes are equal if they have the same tag name, the same set of attributes with the same values, and (ignoring comments and processing instructions), contain two equal-length sequences of pairwise equal content nodes
Two XDocument objects are equal if their root nodes are equal
Two XComment nodes are equal if they contain the same comment text
Two XProcessingInstruction nodes are equal if they have the same target and data
Two XDocumentType nodes are equal if the have the same name, public ID, system ID, and internal subset

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer.System#Collections#IEqualityComparer#Equals(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: The IEqualityComparer implementation of Equals
member.returns: true if the objects are equal, false if otherwise

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer.GetHashCode(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNode)
member.summary: Returns a hash code based on the specified XNode
member.returns: An Int32 that contains the value-based hash for the XNode
member.remarks: The hash returned is based on the value of the node and all it's descendants

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXmlLinq.XNodeEqualityComparer.System#Collections#IEqualityComparer#GetHashCode(System.Object)
member.summary: The IEqualityComparer implementation of GetHashCode
member.returns: The Int32 hash

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new queue of the default size (5 elements maximum)

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is currently in the queue
member.param: The element to be located in the queue
member.returns: Whether the element is currently in the queue

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Peek
member.summary: Returns the element at the beginning of the queue without removing it
member.returns: Element at the beginning of the queue, null if the queue is empty

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Enqueue(`0)
member.summary: Add an element to the end of the queue and block indefinitely until the element can be added.
member.param: Element to be added to the queue

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Enqueue(`0,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Add an element to the end of the queue, but only block for the specified amount of time The addition will be continuously attempted until the end of the specified amount of time Enqueue(element, 0) is equivalent to TryToEnqueue(element)
member.param: Element to be added to the queue
member.returns: Whether the addition was successful or not successful and whether it happened within the time period

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Dequeue
member.summary: Remove an object from the queue and block indefinitely until an object can be removed
member.returns: Object from the queue

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Dequeue(`0@)
member.summary: Remove an object from the queue and block indefinitely until an object can be removed
member.param: Returns the element which was dequeued. This element could be null
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether we were successfully able to dequeue an element from the queue or not

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Dequeue(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Remove an object from the queue, but only block for the specified amount of time Dequeue(0) is equivalent to TryToDequeue()
member.returns: First object of the queue, when the removal was successful and it happened within the time period, or null, when the removal was not and it did not happen within the time period

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.Dequeue(System.UInt32,`0@)
member.summary: Remove an object from the queue, but only block for the specified amount of time Dequeue with a timeout of 0 is equivalent to TryToDequeue()
member.param: Returns the element which was dequeued. This element could be null
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether we were successfully able to dequeue an element from the queue or not

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.TryToEnqueue(`0)
member.summary: Attempt to add an element to the end of the queue and do not block
member.param: Element to be added, if successful
member.returns: Whether the addition was successful or not successful

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.TryToDequeue(`0@)
member.summary: Attempt to remove an element from the queue and do not block
member.param: Returns the element which was dequeued. This element could be a null
member.returns: true if we were successfully able to dequeue an element. false if we were unable to dequeue an element

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronQueue`1.TryToDequeue
member.summary: Attempt to remove an element from the queue and do not block
member.returns: First object of the queue, when the removal was successful, or null, when the removal was not

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNamespaceScope.ExcludeXml

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader
member.summary:
SimplSharp.CrestronXml XmlReader Instance of a file supporting Xml Reading. Parameters: input: The stream containing the XML data. The SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader scans the first bytes of the stream looking for a byte order mark or other sign of encoding. When encoding is determined, the encoding is used to continue reading the stream, and processing continues parsing the input as a stream of (Unicode) characters.
Returns: An SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader object used to read the data contained in the stream.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader.MoveToContent
member.summary:
Checks whether the current node is a content (non-white space text, CDATA, Element, EndElement, EntityReference, or EndEntity) node. If the node is not a content node, the reader skips ahead to the next content node or end of file. It skips over nodes of the following type: ProcessingInstruction, DocumentType, Comment, Whitespace, or SignificantWhitespace.
Returns: The XmlReader.NodeType of the current node found by the method or XmlNodeType.None if the reader has reached the end of the input stream.
member.exception: Incorrect XML encountered in the input stream..
member.returns: The XmlReader.NodeType of the current node found by the method or XmlNodeType.None if the reader has reached the end of the input stream.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader.MoveToElement

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader.ReadToDescendant(System.String)
member.summary: Advances the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader to the next descendant element with the specified qualified name.
member.param: The qualified name of the element you wish to move to.
member.returns: true if a matching descendant element is found; otherwise false. If a matching child element is not found, the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader is positioned on the end tag (Crestron.Xml.XmlReader.NodeType is XmlNodeType.EndElement) of the element. If the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader is not positioned on an element when Crestron.Xml.XmlReader.ReadToDescendant(System.String) was called, this method returns false and the position of the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader is not changed.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader.ReadToDescendant(System.String,System.String)

If the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader is not positioned on an element when Crestron.Xml.XmlReader.ReadToDescendant(System.String) was called, this method returns false and the position of the Crestron.Xml.XmlReader is not changed.

member.summary:

Returns: The value of the specified attribute. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlWriter.WriteDocType(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: writes the DOCTYPE declaration with the specified name and optional attributes.
member.param: The name of the DOCTYPE. This must be non-empty.
If non-null it also writes PUBLIC "pubid" "sysid" where pubid and sysid are replaced with the value of the given arguments.
If pubid is null and sysid is non-null it writes SYSTEM "sysid" where sysid is replaced with the value of this argument.
If non-null it writes [subset] where subset is replaced with the value of this argument.
member.exception: This method was called outside the prolog (after the root element).

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current node can have a XmlTextReader.Value other than String.Empty.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.Name
member.summary: Gets the qualified name of the current node.

EntityReferenceThe name of the entity referenced. ProcessingInstructionThe target of the processing instruction. XmlDeclarationThe literal string xml.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.ReadState

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.Settings
member.summary: Gets the XmlReaderSettings object used to create this XmlTextReader instance.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.Value
member.summary: Gets the text value of the current node.
member.returns: The value returned depends on the XmlTextReader.NodeType of the node. The following table lists node types that have a value to return. All other node types return String.Empty.Node Type Value AttributeThe value of the attribute. CDATA The content of the CDATA section. Comment The content of the comment. DocumentType The internal subset. ProcessingInstruction The entire content, excluding the target. SignificantWhitespace The white space within an xml:space= 'preserve' scope. Text The content of the text node. Whitespace The white space between markup. XmlDeclarationThe content of the declaration.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.WhitespaceHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how white space is handled.
member.returns: One of the WhitespaceHandling values. The default is WhitespaceHandling.All (returns Whitespace and SignificantWhitespace nodes).
member.exception: Invalid value specified.
Setting this property when the reader is closed (XmlTextReader.ReadState is ReadState.Closed).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.XmlLang
member.summary: Gets the current xml:lang scope.
member.returns: The current xml:lang scope.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.XmlResolver
member.summary: Sets the XmlResolver used for resolving DTD references.
member.returns: The XmlResolver to use. If set to null, external resources are not resolved.In version 1.1 of the .NET Framework, the caller must be fully trusted in order to specify an XmlResolver.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextReader.XmlSpace
member.summary: Gets the current xml:space scope.
member.returns: One of the XmlSpace values. If no xml:space scope exists, this property defaults to XmlSpace.None.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter
member.summary: Represents a writer that provides a fast, non-cached, forward-only way of generating streams or files containing XML data that conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter.#ctor(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the XmlTextWriter class using the specified System.CrestronIO.TextWriter.
member.param: The TextWriter to write to. It is assumed that the TextWriter is already set to the correct encoding.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter.#ctor(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the XmlTextWriter class using the specified stream and encoding.
member.param: The stream to which you want to write.
The encoding to generate. If encoding is null it writes out the stream as UTF-8 and omits the encoding attribute from the ProcessingInstruction.
member.exception: The encoding is not supported or the stream cannot be written to.
w is null.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter.#ctor(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the XmlTextWriter class using the specified file.
member.param: The filename to write to. If the file exists, it truncates it and overwrites it with the new content.
The encoding to generate. If encoding is null it writes the file out as UTF-8, and omits the encoding attribute from the ProcessingInstruction.
member.exception: The encoding is not supported; the filename is empty, contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters.
Access is denied.
The filename is null.
The directory to write to is not found.
The filename includes an incorrect or invalid syntax for file name, directory name, or volume label syntax.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes this stream and the underlying stream.
member.exception: A call is made to write more output after Close has been called or the result of this call is an invalid XML document.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlTextWriter.WriteDocType(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the DOCTYPE declaration with the specified name and optional attributes.
member.param: The name of the DOCTYPE. This must be non-empty.
If non-null it also writes PUBLIC "pubid" "sysid" where pubid and sysid are replaced with the value of the given arguments.
If pubid is null and sysid is non-null it writes SYSTEM "sysid" where sysid is replaced with the value of this argument.
If non-null it writes [subset] where subset is replaced with the value of this argument.
member.exception: This method was called outside the prolog (after the root element).
name is null or String.Empty-or- the value for name would result in invalid XML.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode.Normalize
member.summary: Puts all XmlText nodes in the full depth of the sub-tree underneath this XmlNode into a "normal" form where only markup (that is, tags, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, and entity references) separates XmlText nodes, that is, there are no adjacent XmlText nodes.
member.remarks: This method can be used to ensure that the DOM view of a document is the same as if it were saved and re-loaded, and is useful when operations (such as XPointer lookups) that depend on a particular document tree structure are to be used.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode.ReplaceChild(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Replaces the child node oldChild with newChild node.
member.param: The new node to put in the child list.
The node being replaced in the list.
member.returns: The node replaced.
member.exception: This node is of a type that does not allow child nodes of the type of the newChild node or the newChild is an ancestor of this node.
The newChild was created from a different document than the one that created this node or the node is read-only or oldChild is not a child of this node.
member.remarks: If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
If the newChild was created from another document, you can use XmlDocument.ImportNode to import the node to the current document. The imported node can then be passed to the ReplaceChild method.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode.SelectSingleNode(System.String)
member.summary: Selects the first XmlNode that matches the XPath expression.
member.returns: The first XmlNode that matches the XPath query or null if no matching node is found. The XmlNode should not be expected to be connected "live" to the XML document. That is, changes that appear in the XML document may not appear in the XmlNode, and vice versa.
member.exception: The XPath expression contains a prefix.
member.remarks: If the XPath expression requires namespace resolution, you must use the SelectSingleNode overload which takes an XmlNamespaceManager as its argument. The XmlNamespaceManager is used to resolve namespaces.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode.SelectSingleNode(System.String,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNamespaceManager)
member.summary: Selects the first XmlNode that matches the XPath expression. Any prefixes found in the XPath expression are resolved using the supplied XmlNamespaceManager.
member.param: An XmlNamespaceManager to use for resolving namespaces for prefixes in the XPath expression.
member.returns: The first XmlNode that matches the XPath query or null if no matching node is found. The XmlNode should not be expected to be connected "live" to the XML document. That is, changes that appear in the XML document may not appear in the XmlNode, and vice versa.
member.exception: The XPath expression contains a prefix which is not defined in the XmlNamespaceManager.
member.remarks: XPath expressions can include namespaces. Namespace resolution is supported using the XmlNamespaceManager. If the XPath expression includes a prefix, the prefix and namespace URI pair must be added to the XmlNamespaceManager.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNode.Supports(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Test if the DOM implementation implements a specific feature.
member.param: The package name of the feature to test. This name is not case-sensitive.
This is the version number of the package name to test. If the version is not specified (null), supporting any version of the feature causes the method to return true.
member.returns: true if the feature is implemented in the specified version; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlImplementation
member.summary: Defines the context for a set of XmlDocument objects.
member.remarks: XmlDocument objects that are created from the same implementation share the same XmlNameTable. This enables users to compare attribute and element names between the objects more efficiently. Although the XmlDocument objects share the same implementation, to move nodes from one document to another, you must use the ImportNode method.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlQualifiedName
member.summary: Represents an XML qualified name.
member.remarks: An XML qualified name is a namespace qualified local name in the format of namespace:localname. Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for XmlQualifiedName objects. This class assumes that prefixes are irrelevant. It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":".

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNamedNodeMap
member.summary: Represents a collection of nodes that can be accessed by name or index.
member.remarks: XmlNamedNodeMap is returned by the following three properties. XmlElement.Attributes - Returns XmlAttributeCollection, a class which inherits from XmlNamedNodeMap. XmlDocumentType.Entities - Returns an XmlNamedNodeMap containing XmlEntity objects. The XmlNamedNodeMap is read-only. XmlDocumentType.Notations - Returns an XmlNamedNodeMap containing XmlNotation objects. The XmlNamedNodeMap is read-only.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttributeCollection.System#Collections#ICollection#IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe).
member.value: Returns true if the collection is synchronized.
member.remarks: This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the XmlAttributeCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

SyncRoot returns an object, which can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection. Most collection classes in the System.Collections namespace also implement a Synchronized method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttributeCollection.System#Collections#ICollection#SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.
member.value: Returns the Object that is the root of the collection.
member.remarks: This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the XmlAttributeCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

For collections whose underlying store is not publicly available, the expected implementation is to return the current instance. Note that the pointer to the current instance might not be sufficient for collections that wrap other collections; those should return the underlying collection's SyncRoot property. Most collection classes in the System.Collections namespace also implement a Synchronized method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the collection using the SyncRoot property. The synchronizing code must perform operations on the SyncRoot property of the collection, not directly on the collection. This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection instance.

member.exception: The XmlWriter argument is not initialized.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlEntityReference.BaseURI
member.summary: Gets the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the current node.
member.value: The location from which the node was loaded.
member.remarks: A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. The BaseURI tells you where these nodes came from. If there is no base URI for the nodes being returned (maybe they were parsed from an in-memory string), Empty is returned. BaseURI walks the node tree looking for entity reference boundaries, so if entities are expanded, this information is not preserved and this property returns the location of the XmlDocument in all cases. For additional information on BaseURI and how it behaves with other node types, see XmlNode.BaseURI. This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlEntityReference.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the node is read-only.
member.value: true if the node is read-only; otherwise false. Because XmlEntityReference nodes are read-only, this property always returns true.
member.remarks: A read-only node is one whose properties, attributes, or children cannot be changed. However, you can remove a read-only node from the tree and insert it somewhere else. This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttribute.BaseURI
member.summary: Gets the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the node.
member.remarks: A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. The BaseURI tells you where these nodes came from. For additional information on BaseURI and how it behaves with other node types, see XmlNode.BaseURI. This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttribute.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the namespace prefix of this node.
member.exception: This node is read-only.

The specified prefix contains an invalid character. The specified prefix is malformed. The namespaceURI of this node is null. The specified prefix is "xml", and the namespaceURI of this node is different from "http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace". This node is an attribute, the specified prefix is "xmlns", and the namespaceURI of this node is different from "http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/". This node is an attribute, and the qualifiedName of this node is "xmlns" [Namespaces].
member.remarks: Because changing the prefix of an attribute does not change its namespace URI, changing the prefix of an attribute that is known to have a default value does not create a new attribute with the default value and the original prefix.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttribute.SchemaInfo
member.summary: Gets the post-schema-validation-infoset that has been assigned to this node as a result of schema validation.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlAttribute.Specified
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the attribute value was explicitly set.
member.remarks: true if this attribute was explicitly given a value in the original instance document; otherwise, false. A value of false indicates that the value of the attribute came from the DTD.

The implementation is in charge of this property, not the user. If the user changes the value of the attribute (even if it ends up having the same value as the default/fixed value), then the specified flag is automatically flipped to true. To re-specify the attribute as the default/fixed value from the DTD, the user must delete the attribute. The implementation then makes a new attribute available with specified set to false and the default/fixed value (if one exists). In summary: If the attribute has an assigned value in the document, Specified is true, and the value is the assigned value. If the attribute has no assigned value in the document and has a default/fixed value in the DTD, Specified is false, and the value is the default/fixed value in the DTD. Otherwise, the attribute does not appear in the structure model of the document.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the node.
member.exception: The node is read-only and a set operation is called.

member.summary: Provides text manipulation methods that are used by several classes.

member.summary: Internal default constructor for the Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlCharacterData

member.summary: Creates a Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlCharacterData.
member.param: The content of the instruction; see the Data property.

members.member:
Appends the specified string to the end of the character data of the node.
The string to insert into the existing string. This method raises the XmlNodeChangedAction.Change event. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding AppendData in a derived class, in order for events to be raised correctly, you must either raise the event yourself or call the base version of this method. strData is not initialized.

Removes a range of characters from the node.
The position within the string to start deleting. The number of characters to delete. This method raises the XmlNodeChangedAction.Change event. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding DeleteData in a derived class, in order for events to be raised correctly, you must either raise the event yourself or call the base version of this method.

Inserts the specified string at the specified character offset.
The position within the string to insert the supplied string data. The string data that is to be inserted into the existing string. This method raises the XmlNodeChangedAction.Change event. Notes to Inheritors: When overriding InsertData in a derived class, in order for events to be raised correctly, you must either raise the event yourself or call the base version of this method. strData is not initialized.

Replaces the specified number of characters starting at the specified offset with the specified string.
The position within the string to start replacing. The number of characters to replace. The new data that replaces the old string data. This method raises the XmlNodeChangedAction.Change event. Note to Inheritors: When overriding ReplaceData in a derived class, in order for events to be raised correctly, you must either raise the event yourself or call the base version of this method. strData is not initialized.

member.summary: Retrieves a substring of the full string from the specified range.
member.param: The position within the string to start retrieving. An offset of zero indicates the starting point is at the start of the data.
The number of characters to retrieve.
member.returns: The substring corresponding to the specified range.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: Moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (the position of the reader does not change).
member.remarks: Use this method to return to an element after navigating through its attributes. This method moves the reader to one of the following node types: Element, DocumentType, or XmlDeclaration.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeReader.MoveToFirstAttribute

member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.

member.summary: Reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.
member.remarks: When a reader is first created and initialized, there is no information available. You must call Read to read the first node.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeReader.ReadAttributeValue

member.returns: true if there are nodes to return. false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.CreateXmlDeclaration(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a with the specified values
member.param: The value of the encoding attribute. This is the encoding that is used when you save the XmlDocument to a file or a stream; therefore, it must be set to a string supported by the Encoding class, otherwise Save fails. If this is null or String.Empty, the Save method does not write an encoding attribute on the XML declaration and therefore the default encoding, UTF-8, is used
The value must be either "yes" or "no". If this is null or String.Empty, the Save method does not write a standalone attribute on the XML declaration
member.returns: Returns a
member.exception: The version or standalone parameters have invalid values
