member.exception: There is a load or parse error in the XML.
There was an error parsing the XML.
member.remarks: By default the LoadXml method does not preserve white space or significant white space.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.ReadNode(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Creates an XmlNode based on the information in the XmlReader, the reader must be positioned on a node or attribute
member.returns: The new XmlNode or null if no more nodes exist
member.exception: The reader is positioned on a node type that does not translate to a valid DOM node, ex. EndElement or EndEntity
member.remarks: Reads an XmlNode from the reader and advances the position to the next node
If the reader is in the initial state ReadNode advances the reader to the first node and operates on that node
If the reader is positioned on an attribute this method does not move to the next attribute

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.Save(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the XML document to the specified stream.
member.param: The stream to which you want to save.
member.exception: The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).
member.remarks: White space is preserved only if PreserveWhitespace is set to true.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.Save(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Saves the XML document to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The XmlWriter to which you want to save.
member.exception: The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).
member.remarks: White space is preserved only if PreserveWhitespace is set to true.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the XML document to the specified file.
member.param: The path to the file where you want to save the document.
member.exception: The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).
The user does not have the required permissions.
Invalid directory location passed.
The file was not found
member.remarks: White space is preserved only if PreserveWhitespace is set to true.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.Save(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronIO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Saves the XML document to the specified TextWriter.
member.param: The TextWriter to which you want to save.
member.exception: The operation would not result in a well formed XML document (for example, no document element or duplicate XML declarations).
member.remarks: The encoding of the XmlDeclaration node is replaced by the encoding of the TextWriter

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.WriteContentTo(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Saves all the children of the XmlDocument node to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The XmlWriter to which you want to save.
member.remarks: The XmlDeclaration.Encoding property determines the encoding that is written out. If the Encoding property does not have a value, the XmlDocument is written out without an encoding attribute.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.WriteTo(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Saves the XmlDocument node to the specified XmlWriter.
member.param: The XmlWriter to which you want to save.
member.remarks: The XmlDeclaration.Encoding property determines the encoding that is written out. If the Encoding property does not have a value, the XmlDocument is written out without an encoding attribute.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an XmlNodeList containing a list of all descendant elements that match the specified Name
member.param: The qualified name to match. It is matched against the Name property of the matching node. The special value "*" matches all tags
member.returns: A containing a list of all matching nodes. If no nodes match name, the returned collection will be empty
member.remarks: The nodes are placed in the order in which they would be encountered in the document

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.GetElementsByTagName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an XmlNodeList containing a list of all descendant elements that match the specified LocalName and NamespaceURI
member.param: The LocalName to match. The special value "*" matches all tags
member.returns: A containing a list of all matching nodes. If no nodes match the specified localName and namespaceURI, the returned collection will be empty
member.remarks: The nodes are placed in the order in which they would be encountered in the document tree

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.Implementation
member.summary: Gets the object for the current document
member.remarks: XmlDocument objects created from the same share the same . This allows users to compare attribute and element names as objects rather than strings
Although the XmlDocument objects share the same implementation, to move nodes from one document to another you must use the ImportNode method.

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the Value of a node belonging to this document has been changed
member.remarks: This event only applies to nodes that have a value
All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeChanging
member.summary: Occurs when the Value of a node belonging to this document is about to be changed
member.remarks: This event allows the user to do extra checking and, if necessary, throw an exception to stop the operation. If an exception is thrown the XmlDocument returns to its original state. This event only applies to nodes that have a value
All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeInserted
member.summary: Occurs when a node belonging to this document has been inserted into another node
member.remarks: All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeInserting
member.summary: Occurs when a node belonging to this document is about to be inserted into another node
member.remarks: This event allows the user to do extra checking and, if necessary, throw an exception to stop the operation. If an exception is thrown the XmlDocument returns to its original state. This event only applies to nodes that have a value
All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeRemoved
member.summary: Occurs when a node belonging to this document has been removed from its parent
member.remarks: All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.name: E:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlDocument.NodeRemoving
member.summary: Occurs when a node belonging to this document is about to be removed from the document
member.remarks: This event allows the user to do extra checking and, if necessary, throw an exception to stop the operation. If an exception is thrown the XmlDocument returns to its original state. This event only applies to nodes that have a value
All nodes created by this document, whether or not they have been inserted into the document, are included in this event

member.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node

member.returns: The cloned node
member.remarks: CloneNode serves as a copy constructor for nodes. For text nodes, the cloned node always includes the data value. To see how this method behaves with other node types, see the CloneNode method in the XmlNode class. The cloned node has no parent. (ParentNode returns null)

member.summary: For internal use

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class

The new parent of the that generated the event

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.Action
member.summary: Gets a value indicating what type of node change event is occurring
member.remarks: The Action value does not differentiate between when the event occurred (before or after). You can create separate event handlers to handle both instances

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.NewParent
member.summary: Gets the value of the ParentNode after the operation completes
member.value: The value of the ParentNode after the operation completes. This property returns null if the node is being removed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: Gets the new value of the node
member.value: The new value of the node. This property returns null if the node is neither an attribute nor a text node, or if the node is being removed. If called in a NodeChanging event, NewValue returns the value of the node if the change is successful. If called in a NodeChanged event, NewValue returns the current value of the node

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.Node
member.summary: Gets the that is being added, removed or changed
member.value: The that is being added, removed or changed; this property never returns null

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.OldParent
member.summary: Gets the value of the ParentNode before the operation began
member.value: The value of the ParentNode before the operation began. This property returns null if the node did not have a parent

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronXml.XmlNodeChangedEventArgs.OldValue
member.summary: Gets the original value of the node
member.value: The original value of the node. This property returns null if the node is neither an attribute nor a text node, or if the node is being inserted. If called in a NodeChanging event, OldValue returns the current value of the node that will be replaced if the change is successful. If called in a NodeChanged event, OldValue returns the value of node prior to the change

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.PipeStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.param: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
member.exception: The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.
The stream does not support reading.
buffer is null.
An I/O error occurs.
offset or count is negative.

buffer is null.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Ssh.Common.PipeStream.BlockLastReadBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to block last read method before the buffer is empty. When true, Read() will block until it can fill the passed in buffer and count. When false, Read() will not block, returning all the available buffer data.
member.remarks: Setting to true will remove the possibility of ending a stream reader prematurely.
member.value: true if block last read method before the buffer is empty; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharp.Net.Http.HttpServer.KeepAlive
member.summary: Controls whether to use HTTP Keep-Alive to keep the connection alive between requests. If enabled (true), once a request is made and a connection is established, this connection is kept open and used for future requests. If disabled, the connection is closed, and a new connection is created for future requests.
member.remarks: Default value is true.
